Checkout my TIE section (Today I Explored):
Posts outlining the topics in Computer Science and/or Mathematics that I have focused on.

Welcome!

My name is Kelle Clark, and I am a Mathematics and Computer Science enthusiast. This site allows me to journal my exploration into these fields, catelog great resources and share my ideas with others.

Navigate to either my TIE (Today I Explored) blog-like page or Projects page or keep scrolling to see my featured Github projects.

Your feedback and suggestions are welcome for topics for me to look into. Email me at clarkke20@students.ecu.edu


or find me on LinkedIn and Twitter:

Interesting Videos and Resources

Natural Language Processing

Using a Python Interactive Notebook, this project focuses on using the maximum likelyhood of ngrams derived from a training set of texts. Useable models are constructed and tested with a input text to predict the next word (words) for the input text.
